meanings.definition: To rest or relax after exertion.
meanings.sent1: After running a marathon, she reested on the couch for hours.
meanings.sent2: I always reested on the weekends to recharge for the week ahead.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy reested in the shade after playing fetch all day.
meanings.sent4: His mind reested on the idea of a peaceful vacation far away.
meanings.sent5: The old tree reested in the gentle breeze, swaying peacefully.

meanings.definition: To settle or come to a stop.
meanings.sent1: The snow reested on the ground, covering everything in white.
meanings.sent2: The butterfly finally reested on a flower after fluttering around.
meanings.sent3: The ball reested in the corner of the room, forgotten by the players.
meanings.sent4: The decision to move forward or reested in her hands, uncertain and heavy.
meanings.sent5: The dust motes reested in the sunlight, creating a magical dance in the air.

meanings.definition: To be supported or propped up.
meanings.sent1: The shelf reested against the wall, holding up books and trinkets.
meanings.sent2: His tired body reested against the soft pillows, finding comfort.
meanings.sent3: The ladder reested against the tree, waiting for the adventurous cat to climb.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes and dreams reested on the support of her loving family.
meanings.sent5: The bridge reested over the flowing river, connecting two sides of the town.
